results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: A young girl is given a video recorder as a gift. Structured as a video and super-8 diary, this compelling short film investigates the devastating effects on a child of adult secrets. This exceptional Australian short film is a first person narrative conveyed completely through point of view and mise-en-scene. Cast features Steve Jacobs and Lynette Curran.

results.title: Japan: Tokyo to Taiwan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Ian Wright conducts this Lonely planet tour of Japan, experiencing the bullet train at 160 miles per hour, having his fortune read at a Buddhist shrine, visiting the peace museum in Nagasaki, and soaking up the fantastic environment at the Aso Fire Festival.

results.title: The Chain Reaction
results.creator_credit: Ian Barry, Ross Matthews and Palm Beach Pictures
results.brief_description: A thriller in which a married couple are thrown into a world of terror, after being contaminated with radioactivity. Cast includes Steve Bisley, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Lorna Lesley. Photography by Nixon Binney.

results.title: Cuba and Haiti
results.creator_credit: Jenny Dames, Dawn Beresford and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Cuba is the largest and least commercialised country in the Caribbean. Political factors too have kept tourists away since Castro’s revolution in the fifties. Beginning his journey in the famous Cuban capital of Havana, Ian Wright travels across Cuba, skydiving onto a Havana beach, visiting a Cuban cigar factory, swimming with dolphins, visiting the Che Guevara University and watching a voodoo ceremony in Haiti. His journey ends in Haiti, the oldest black republic in the world.

results.title: Roadside cafe
results.brief_description: A lonely young woman working in an isolated roadhouse is desperate to escape the inevitability of her future. She makes hopeful overtures toward the only people that she meets - the truckies and families who frequent the cafe but is met with ugliness and hostility. Cast features LeVerne McDonnell. Original format 16mm/colour.

results.title: Experience Indonesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Independent traveller Mark Crowdy, avoiding the more popular tourist resorts, travels to the lesser known eastern islands of Flores, Komodo, Amban and Banda. His ultimate aim was “to find people and places who hadn’t been jaded by tourism.” The Lonely Planet travel series opens up new possibilities in travelling for the intrepid explorer, while armchair travellers can sit back in comfort and enjoy rare and beautiful locations.

results.title: The Celluloid heroes: 1896-1996 Celebrating 100 years of Australian Cinema. - Vol. 2.
results.creator_credit: Robert Francis, Donald Crombie, Anthony Buckley, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Episode 3: Arising from the ashes. 1949-1970. The post-war film world was dominated by Hollywood giants but local heroes achieved huge success in “Smiley” and “Jedda” with stars like Chips Rafferty and Bud Tingwell. This episode explores the influences which encouraged success in the Australian film industry and overviews Australian life during the Menzies era and ‘60’s - the point where the industry gained a financial footing for the first time in decades. Episode 4: Beyond our wildest dreams. 1971-1995. The era when our cinema was reborn with the classics “Picnic at hanging rock”, The Chant of Jimmy Blacksmith”, “Mad Max”, “Breaker Morant” and “Gallipoli. This renaissance fostered the talents of Mel Gibson, Judy Davis and the directors Peter Weir, Gillian Armstrong, George Miller and Bruce Beresford. Australia’s image internationally consolidated with “Crocodile Dundee”, Strictly Ballroom”, “The Adventures of Priscilla Queen of the Desert and “Muriel’s Wedding”. Within 25 years the film industry had moved from near extinction to a point beyond our wildest dreams. Narrated by Bryan Brown.
results.title_for_label: The Celluloid heroes: 1896-1996 Celebrating 100 years of Australian Cinema. - Vol. 2.

results.title: Argentina
results.creator_credit: Colin Napthine, Deborah Hinnigan and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Argentina is a land of many contrasts, a land where the magnificent desolation of Patagonia and the Andes contrast dramatically with the urban frenzy of Buenos Aires, one of the world’s largest and most cosmopolitan cities. In this instalment of ‘The Lonely planet’ series, traveller Justine Shapiro visits Iguazu Falls, travels on one of the most spectacular railway journeys in Latin America, spends a day with gauchos, learns to tango, and visits the San Moreno glacier at the tip of Latin America.

results.title: The Cat returns = Neko no ongaeshi
results.creator_credit: Hiroyuki Morita, Nozomu Takahashi, Toshio Suzuki and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Animated fantasy adventure about a young high school girl, Haru, who finds herself being rewarded for a good deed carried out as a child. She simply feeds a hungry kitten but when this unique kitten grows, it is decided in the cat kingdom that Haru is special and should be given gifts. Daughter of a single mother, the young girl has the usual teenage angst and wants to impress the handsome boy in her class. Her usual routine is forgotten however as she is transported to the Kingdom of Cats. Haru also unwittingly finds herself engaged to the Prince of Cats! A coming-of-age film with a difference as this is a magical and fantastic adventure suitable for family viewing. From the creators of award winning “Spirited Away” [318123] the moving classical soundtrack adds to the enchanting nature of the story.
